clinical_study.official_title: Effect of Use of Hypotension Prediction System in Prevention of Postoperative Acute Kidney Injury in Radical Cystectomy

brief_summary.textblock: It is a single-center randomized controlled trial that aims to figure out the effect of the hypotension prediction index (HPI) on the prevention of acute kidney injury (AKI) after radical cystectomy. The primary hypothesis is that HPI software guidance prevents postoperative AKI by reducing the duration and severity of intraoperative hypotension (IOH).

primary_outcome.description: Occurrence of acute kidney injury after radical cystectomy

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From applying HPI (hypotension prediction index) monitor to the arterial line to the end of the anesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: Depth and duration of hypotension will be assessed by calculating time weighted average (TWA) of hypotension under mean arterial pressure under 65 mmHg during the operation

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From applying HPI (hypotension prediction index) monitor to the arterial line to the end of the anesthesia
secondary_outcome.description: Time weighted average of hypotension prediction index during the operation

arm_group.description: Managing intraoperative hemodynamic condition under the HPI guidance
Managing intraoperative hemodynamic condition with standard anesthesia care (blinding the HPI monitor screen)

intervention.description: The hemodynamic condition of the HPI group will be managed by HPI guidance which is derived by arterial pressure waveform information, including Eadyn, SVV, dP/dt.
